head.title: MetroStars Rally To Beat Farm Team

hedline.hl1: MetroStars Rally To Beat Farm Team

abstract.p: MetroStars defeat their A-League affiliate, 4-2, in exhibition game (S)1

block.p: The MetroStars rallied from a two-goal deficit last night for a 4-2 victory over the Long Island Rough Riders, their affiliate in the A-League. The annual exhibition was played at EAB Field in East Islip, N.Y.

The Rough Riders took a 2-0 lead on a goal by Jesse Van Saun and a penalty kick by Gerry Lucey in the first half, but the MetroStars scored four goals after halftime. Julian Gomez scored the first and last ones, with Daniel Hernandez and Roy Myers getting goals in between.

The MetroStars rallied from a two-goal deficit last night for a 4-2 victory over the Long Island Rough Riders, their affiliate in the A-League. The annual exhibition was played at EAB Field in East Islip, N.Y.

The Rough Riders took a 2-0 lead on a goal by Jesse Van Saun and a penalty kick by Gerry Lucey in the first half, but the MetroStars scored four goals after halftime. Julian Gomez scored the first and last ones, with Daniel Hernandez and Roy Myers getting goals in between.

For the first time since June 24, Mike Ammann returned to goal after an injury and saved a penalty kick for the MetroStars, who used 15 players in the game. Ammann played the entire game in what has been tabbed the Grapple for the Apple.
